com.pump.animation.quicktime

Class MovWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.animation.quicktime.MovWriter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JPEGMovWriter, PNGMovWriter

    public abstract class MovWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    This writes a QuickTime MOV file as a series of images, and interleaves optional PCM (uncompressed) audio.

    This abstract class does not actually encode the image data; subclasses decide how to do this. The only two current subclasses use either JPG or PNG compression. By modern standards: this results in a very poorly compressed image file, but it is free of painful legal implications that come with the MPEG-4 standard. (And it is worlds easier to implement.)

    This actually writes to a movie file in 2 passes: the first pass writes all the video and audio data to a FileOutputStream. When close() is called, the movie structure is added and a RandomAccessFile is used to correctly set the size headers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static class  MovWriter.InvalidDurationException
      This is used to indicate that a frame requested an unacceptable duration, such as 0 or -1.
      static class  MovWriter.InvalidFileLengthException
      This is used to indicate that the file used to create a frame was too small.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovWriter

        public MovWriter(java.io.File file)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a new MovWriter.

        By constructing this object a FileOutputStream is opened for the destination file. It remains open until close() is called or this object is finalized.

        Parameters:
        file - the file data is written to. It is strongly recommended that this file name end with ".mov" (or ".MOV"), although this is not required.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • addAudioTrack

        public void addAudioTrack(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream audio,
                          float startTime)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Add an AudioInputStream to this movie. The audio data will be interleaved with the visual data in the output movie.

        This method must be called before adding frames. In a future version of this class it would be nice if audio could be inserted at any time (before calling close()), but currently that functionality is not supported.

        Parameters:
        audio - the audio to add to this movie. Preferably this should use PCM encoding, but this class uses AudioSystem to convert the stream to PCM if it is not already.
        startTime - the start time (in seconds) of this audio in the movie. For example: if this is 5, then this audio will begin 5 seconds into the movie.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if you invoke this method after calling addFrame() or close().

      • addAudioTrack

        public void addAudioTrack(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream audio,
                          float startTime,
                          float endTime)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Add an AudioInputStream to this movie. The audio data will be interleaved with the visual data in the output movie.

        This method must be called before adding frames. In a future version of this class it would be nice if audio could be inserted at any time (before calling close()), but currently that functionality is not supported.

        Parameters:
        audio - the audio to add to this movie. Preferably this should use PCM encoding, but this class uses AudioSystem to convert the stream to PCM if it is not already.
        startTime - the start time (in seconds) of this audio in the movie. For example: if this is 5, then this audio will begin 5 seconds into the movie.
        endTime - the end time (in seconds) of this audio in the movie. If the audio would normally last past this time: then it is cut off. (If the audio runs out before this time: then this argument has no effect.)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if you invoke this method after calling addFrame() or close().

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame(float duration,
                     java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> settings)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Adds an image to this animation.

        All images must be the same dimensions; if this image is a different size from previously added images an exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        duration - the duration (in seconds) this frame should show. (This value is converted to a timescale of DEFAULT_TIME_SCALE.)
        bi - the image to add as a frame.
        settings - an optional map of settings subclasses may use to encode this data. For example, the JPEGMovWriter may consult this map to determine the image quality of the JPEG it writes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeFrame

        protected abstract void writeFrame(java.io.OutputStream out,
                                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> settings)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame(float duration,
                     java.io.File image)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Adds an image to this animation.

        All images must be the same dimensions; if this image is a different size from previously added images an exception is thrown.

        This method is provided as a convenient way to quickly merge frames into a movie. It does not, however, type check the images, or convert images that are not of the correct file type. (For example: if you add TIFF image files to a MovWriter that expects JPG image files, then no exception will be thrown. But the new mov file will be unreadable.)

        Parameters:
        duration - the duration (in seconds) this frame should show. (This value is converted to a timescale of DEFAULT_TIME_SCALE.)
        image - the image to add.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getVideoSampleDescriptionEntry

        protected abstract com.pump.animation.quicktime.VideoSampleDescriptionEntry getVideoSampleDescriptionEntry()
        Subclasses must define the VideoSampleDescriptionEntry this writer uses.

      • close

        public void close(boolean writeRemainingAudio)
           throws java.io.IOException
        This finishes writing the movie file.
        Parameters:
        writeRemainingAudio - if true then unfinished AudioInputStreams continue to write to the movie file. If false then the movie ends immediately. If an operation is canceled you should pass false here to speed up the time it takes to close everything out.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
